result.execSummary:
The defendant Lisa M Walden was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
CORRECTED 08-06-2015:  Term of Probation is corrected to 1 year.
Concurrent with: Case 14CF1001.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to resitution - PAID IN FULL.
Cash bail applied to court costs - PAID IN FULL.  Court waives DNA surcharge.
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling.
AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended.

ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.
Submit to random urine screens.
No use or possession of alcohol, illegal drugs or drug paraphernalia.
No use or possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of any and all prescriptions.
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent.
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged and distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (for example, bars, taverns or liquor stores).
Ignition interlock device installed for the period of probation.
Not to drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.
Case 14CM536 is dismissed and read in.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lisa M Walden

records.addlTxt: Filed by Department of Corrections requesting clarification of probationary term ordered for count 1.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Katrina Seipel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant Lisa M Walden in court with attorney Michael Hart.   
Case called along with:  14CF1001 & 14CM536

Defendant enters a plea of No Contest to count 1.
Court finds the defendant Guilty of count 1.
Counts 2 & 3 are dismissed as read ins.
Defendant presented a statement to the court.


Court orders the following:
SENTENCE WITHHELD.

Term of Probation:  2 Years.
Concurrent with:  Case 14CF1001
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:  
AODA Assessment and follow through with any treatment recommended;
Absolute Sobriety;  Random U.A.'s ; 
No Use or Possession of alcohol, controlled substances or drug paraphernalia
No Use or Possession of prescription drugs without a valid prescription;
Any valid prescription drugs must be taken only in the manner in which they are prescribed.
Inform Agent of all prescriptions
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
No association with known drug users or dealers and no contact at any place where illegal drugs are purchased, used, stored, packaged, or distributed.
No presence on any premises whose primary business is serving or selling alcohol (i.e bars, taverns, or liquor stores).
Ignition Interlock Device installed for the period of probation.  
Do not drive or operate a motor vehicle without a valid license.


Restitution:  $190.47 (to be paid to Roundy's).
Costs:  $243
DRGOD Surcharge:  $10
DNA Surcharge:  Court Waives.
To be paid in full out of the bail money on case:  14CF1001.
Plea/sentencing hearing on July 7, 2015 at 03:00 pm.

Defendant Lisa M Walden in court with attorney Geoffrey R Misfeldt by Atty. Michael Hart.

File not called on the record.
